text.__SUMMARY__: The greater dog-like bat (Peropteryx kappleri) is a bat species from Central America and South America.  It is found from southern Mexico through Brazil and Peru.
text.Description:
It is the largest member of its genus, with a forearm length of 45–53.6 mm (1.77–2.11 in).
Individuals weigh approximately 8 g (0.28 oz).
Fur color can vary, with some individuals dark brown and others light brown.
The ventral fur is paler than the dorsal fur.
It has large black ears.
Its dental formula is 1.1.2.33.1.2.3 for a total of 32 teeth.
